variants.Description in input context: The c.1850C>T variant results in a p.Arg617Trp substitution, altering the protein's interaction domain.

Material used.Material Name: HEK293 cells and STXBP1 knockout mice
Material used.Description: Experiments were performed using HEK293 cells overexpressing STXBP1 and STXBP1 knockout mice reconstituted with the variant-containing STXBP1 gene.

Readout description.Result Description: The variant p.Arg617Trp demonstrated a 30% reduction in binding affinity to PSD-95, a known interacting partner of STXBP1, when assessed by co-immunoprecipitation.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent experiments with different cell passages were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate for quantification.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type STXBP1 was used as a positive control demonstrating full binding affinity.

Basic negative control.Description: A vector containing no insert served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by post-hoc Tukey's test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding affinity within 15% of the wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Binding affinity reduced by more than 15% compared to the wild-type control.

Material used.Material Name: STXBP1 knockout mice reconstituted with the variant-containing STXBP1 gene
Material used.Description: Mice lacking endogenous STXBP1, but expressing the variant gene, were used.

Readout description.Result Description: The mice reconstituted with the variant showed significant deficits in social interaction compared to wildtype littermates, as measured by the three-chamber social approach test.

Biological replicates.Description: Each mouse group consisted of n=10 subjects. Four distinct cohorts were employed.

Basic positive control.Description: Wildtype littermates were used as a control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Repeated measures ANOVA followed by post-hoc Tukey's test was used for statistical analysis.
